website_summaries.verdict: Cute and practical. Worth considering if you want a character-themed design to liven up your toddler's room.
pros: Fun characters, bright colors, and a sturdy steel frame
cons: Some owners have trouble with rails and other components not matching up to their designated slots during assembly

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it.
customer_reviews.text: Using this as a bed for my dogs. They love it.
customer_reviews.author: Fire2999

customer_reviews.title: A Very Happy Mommy of A Happy Toddler!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my babygirls BIG girl Elmo bed and so does she! I definitely think it is worth the price and way bigger than I could have imagined which is Awesome! I am a very happy customer and so is my Happy Little Toddler😊
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Lynn Manahan

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves this cute little bed!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson spends a lot of time with us so I thought I'd buy him his own bed. It was rather tight putting together but I think that was for safety as you don't want parts to come loose. It took two of us to put it together. There's few parts but lots of screws. It might even make you say a few curse words putting it together but keep in mind it's for someone special so safety first! Plus, it use to be hard to get him to bed but now he gets in all by himself
customer_reviews.author: MadamTM

customer_reviews.title: This was a bust.
customer_reviews.text: NOT FOR ROUDY BOYS!!! I bought the Lightning McQueen bed for my very active son back in March. If you have a ROUDY boy, this bed is NOT for them! Seriously, he broke the plastic side guard off on one side and collapsed the metal (METAL!!!) support beam on that side! He weighs 31lbs!!! I don't know how he managed it, but now I'm on the hunt for an actual sturdy bed that is made to last. It gets 3 stars simply because I also bought 2 other beds for my daughter's (34 & 37lbs) and they're slightly bent from jumping but otherwise, structurally sound.
customer_reviews.author: iBuyStuffOnAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful bed
customer_reviews.text: Took awhile to put together because my excited toddler wanted to play and tug the pieces away from me both I absolutely love it we are in a family shelter and they had only a. Crib which my duagther hates I decided to purchase a bed since she's almost 2 and I wanted her to be as comfortable as possible no regrets she loves it and sleeps in it all night . I bought it open box (new) for a cheaper price
customer_reviews.author: TheFabianFamily

customer_reviews.title: Cute Bed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift because the child's mother couldn't get her little one out of her bed. She put this bed together and sat it next to her bed. Her little one jumped right in and has been sleeping in it ever since. I saw this bed at other retailers, but Amazon offered the best price. The bed is a combination of plastic with a little metal. You will need to purchase the mattress separately. I also purchased a pink canopy to go with the bed. Her little one loved the whole setup and that's all that matters.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: It wasn’t difficult to put together, just time consuming. After it was together it appeared to look bowed, like the middle bracket put too much pressure on the sides. When we put the toddler mattress on, you had to literally press it down so hard and wedge it into the bed. At first I didn’t like this but afterwards, I enjoyed there were no gaps between bed/mattress. So no lost toys or crackers.
customer_reviews.author: Keirstonmarie

customer_reviews.title: Good for little boys who are fan of Paw Patrol
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bed frame (with the same brand mattress) for my 3 years old son. He is a fan of Paw Patrol, hence excited. the bed and mattress look durable and suitable for a little one. However, when assembling the bed frame, my husband came across a little problem, i.e. the red color supporting fabric is a bit short/tight to be stretched, in the end, he decided to cut two ends of the sheet a bit so that it can fit. Otherwise, the bed is good. The instruction booklet warns that the maximum user weight is 50 lbs (22.7 kg), hence may only be used for kids between 2-4 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Bolu Wang

customer_reviews.title: Very UPSET 😡
customer_reviews.text: I’m not happy at all with the way the box was ! It was opened on one side ! Taped on the other side from someone else opening it!! The stickers that are supposed to go on the bed are not useable!!😡 they are all wrinkled up like some one did something to them!! 😡 no instructions on how to put bed together!!😡oh and some kind of pink tape on the box inside that has parts in it!! Can’t tell if all parts are definitely here due to NO instructions! I will be writing to company if I do not get together!! 😡 oh and it would be nice if you send me new stickers!!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler bed
customer_reviews.text: This bed is amazing! I was a little worried because it is made of plastic and not wood, however, it turned out that it is very sturdy. I have a 2 year old who has shared a bed with me since birth. She refused to sleep anywhere else. I made the decision to finally get her a toddler bed. I wanted an Elmo one because that is her favorite character. She actually sleeps in her own bed for the most of the night now! The bed does take a bit of time to put together and you do have to add the stickers yourself. I didn't put it together so I can't comment on that. It does look great though!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Unicorn

customer_reviews.title: Great transition bed from a crib
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old son was excited that his new bed arrived and could not wait for me to assemble the bed together. What's nice is that a crib size mattress fits easily into the bed frame so it's a great transition for young ones to go from a crib straight into a toddler bed. The toddler bed frame is also light and easy to move around in the room which is a plus. The colors definitely make it at an attractive bed for kids to want to sleep in and there are a lot of different styled beds that you can select from although the pricing can be quite different one from another.
customer_reviews.author: Arman

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed They sold me a bed that was already used and also it was Mssing Screws try to put it together Yesterday and noticed that there are screws missing not cool I thought I was paying for a brand new bed 50 something dollars that should be a whole brand new bed I don’t understand Why Amazon is selling me a Used toddler bed frame and i payed full price for it it is very hard to put together not a fun experience now I have two find 3 screws that could fit inside of my child bed fram smh do not like this experience at all if I could give it a 0 I would
customer_reviews.author: jazzy

customer_reviews.title: however we were extremely disappointed. The red rails in the picture do not ...
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited to get this bed set up for our son's new Sesame Street themed room at his grandmother's house, however we were extremely disappointed. The red rails in the picture do not lock into the bed - they don't even sit on the bed, so our toddler is supposed to sleep in a bed with no rails? What's the point of the rails if they don't connect to the bed in anyway? I would assume the rails are meant to be as picture, so my only logical explanation is we received a broken product. Highly disappointed. Waste of money. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ThAzam

customer_reviews.title: Like them enough that I've bought two a year apart.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. I have 3 kids under 4 and was able to put it together by myself in an hour, even with all three in the immediate area. This is our second Delta bed. My 3 y/o has had his (paw patrol) for a year. Still holds up well. Only signs of wear it shows is that he and his brother have peeled one of the footboard stickers off. But we've been happy enough with the 3 y/o's bed that we just bought one for ours who just turned two and learned how to climb out of his pack and play. All in all, very satisfied. Will likely purchase again when my newborn is their age.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: CUTE and AFFORDABLE
customer_reviews.text: Money well spent! My son loves it, and the price is right. I had a little trouble aligning the stickers without getting bubbles since they are so large, but other than that, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: LaDanah

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Our movers destroyed our wooden toddler bed so bought this as a replacement. It was very easy to put put together if you have two people. A little bit of a challenge aligning the holes correctly if you’re doing it yourself. We used the same mattress that we purchased for a crib and fits perfectly. You can also get the Paw Patrol sheet set for relatively cheap. Our 2 year old loves it.
customer_reviews.author: TBD

customer_reviews.title: Good toddler bed
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my 3YO kid. She wanted a Lion king themed bed. So, she was super excited to see that. The packaging was great and the instructions were also great. However, assembling it was a bit of hassle specially if you don't have time. I took the help of one other person in order to assemble it. With two people it is quite straight forward to assemble. The base of the bed is not hard. It is a cloth base and hence you need a good mattress for the bed. Nevertheless the bed looks really nice in her room and she enjoys sleeping in it.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Solid, sturdy and a nice style
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my grandson who is 34 pounds at this point. Assembly time was reasonable but he helped so it may have taken a bit longer! The frame seems sturdy with the mattress lying on a nylon support that slides over the side bars. I paired this with the Graco premium foam mattress and a water resistant mattress pad. The mattees cover that comes with it is also water resistant. Overall the bed it light weight and I just move it to another room when not needed. He really likes it, and says the paw patrol guys keep him safe at night.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE BEST TO ASSEMBLE
customer_reviews.text: This bed took up my entire morning and afternoon the instructions seem simple but it was frustrating putting this together seem like the parts were not even which made it more difficult to assemble. When it arrived, I thought it would be easy to put together but I was wrong once we finally got it completed it came out nice and my daughter loves it but it was definitely a struggle. I'm sure we will be upgrading to a bigger bed the taller she gets because this bed is so short.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Nice little bed
customer_reviews.text: My grandson LOVES PJ Masks, and so this bed was a no brainer. He loves it, it was easy to assemble, only took about 15 minutes and a Phillips head screwdriver. Its sturdy, the stickers are nice and look like they will last for awhile. I like that its a hard plastic because he's notorious for jumping around, this way the likelihood of "permanent" damage to my grandson is unlikely, there are no sharp edges or anything sticking out that he will likely injure himself on, nor any space for heads, arms, legs, etc. to get stuck in. He's destructive (more than the average child) but I have high hopes for this bed lasting awhile.
customer_reviews.author: L. K. H.

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP! CHEAP! 🐣
customer_reviews.text: Cute and Cheap. I got this bed because my daughter loves FROZEN.... you would be better getting posters or stuffed animals ... a rug or curtains than this CHEAP bed. You’re paying for DISNEY and the CHEAP STICKER (that comes off as soon as you put it on). Liking the idea of a bed that will go with a themed room yet OPP for a wooden or metal bed frame—- Spray paint or paint your own colors.... add stickers....glitter or whatever but this bed frame was crap. Literally a daycare cot with plastic headboard and footboard 😑 Waste of time. Waste of energy. I rate 3 out of 10.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Ngaryo

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his new bed! Plus the fact its TOY STORY!! As a parent I love that my child doesn't have to get a new mattress, the crib one works with this style bed frame. I, the momma, assembled it my self! So its pretty easy to follow the directions that come with as I do not like to read instructions as a rule. All in all very happy I purchased this! My son was falling out of his crib/toddler bed. I placed a mesh so he wouldn't but it became his new jungle gym. This is perfect height and not as scary if he falls out of bed or, forbid, jumps...
customer_reviews.author: Big Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great except the plastic supports
customer_reviews.text: The bed is good, was not too bad to assemble by myself. My only issue is the middle supports are made of plastic and have 1 bolt on each one running through them to the frame. When I went to tight them down they seemed to pull through the plastic. I stopped tightening them as soon as I notice this but I could easily someone who is not paying attention tightening them so far that the bolt pulls straight through the plastic and renders the plastic supports useless.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Clayton Jr

customer_reviews.title: Frozen bed set for toddler
customer_reviews.text: The installation for this bed was rather easy and only required a Phillips head screwdriver. It took me 45 mins or so to do it. Could have done it faster but daughter was so excited and playing with all the parts. The mattress &B bed set is NOT included with the bed. I purchased the mattress off Amazon and the Frozen II set from Target. Bedding was for a twin bed not exact size. The bed is perfect for frozen fans. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toddler bed, especially for chewers!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this bed for my 2yo after we caught him chewing on the wooden bed we already had for him. He absolutely LOVES this toddler bed and we have successfully transitioned him to this bed in just one night. He loves just sitting in it and reading books, and I always catch him staring at the characters. Easy to assemble in 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Dusseault

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it! Solid. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: Grandson (23mos) loves it! Assembly instructions we just OK, although easy enough to figure out w/out them. Knocked off a star because: 1)the manufacturer left sharp flash on when the punched out a couple of the holes that required my removal before assembly, and 2) I was a little disappointed in the alignment of the bolt holes in the legs, which required a little extra effort to assemble. Overall it seems sturdy enough to last a pretty good while. I WOULD purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: For the price, it's worth it
customer_reviews.text: For the price, we rate it five stars. We paid less than fifty dollars for something that will last forever if taken care of. It is good quality and wasn't too difficult to assemble. I think it's odd how tight of a fit his crib mattress is, you have to really force it into this bed frame and it's a struggle to do so without the fitted sheet getting messed up. All in all, my son adores it and it completed his new Paw Patrol room.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie Gerke

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and so pretty.
customer_reviews.text: Delta children does not disappoint. All their products are so affordable. Our toddler room is entirely furnished with delta children's various furniture pieces. I bought the Minnie mouse toddler bed. It's very sturdy and great quality. It took me 30-45 min to assemble but its a cot I'm assembling, so that's expected. I got a toddler size mattress to go with it. My 20 month-old toddler loves her cot. She climbs on the bed and plays on it like a bounce house. Its doesn't even make a noise when she jumps on it. She lies face down and studies all the cute details on the decals.
customer_reviews.author: kamali rathinam

customer_reviews.title: My toddler loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves paw patrol. He stopped sleeping in his crib a year ago and has since slept in my bed. But I have finally been able to get him out of my bed and into his own "big boy" bed. But note that even though it does fit the original crib mattress it is plastic and noisy, so I did need to buy him a foam mattress so it could feel closer to a real bed. Of course if your little one is use to that then it's great
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Spencer

customer_reviews.title: None of the screws went in easily... but overall, great bed
customer_reviews.text: I’ve literally been sitting here for a good half hour trying to get these damn screws to go in their rightful places and as soon as I get one in the slot the next one won’t go in. Assembly was anything but easy. My patience was tested with these damn screws... buuuuuuuuut, once I put the bed together and saw the absolute look on joy on my daughters face it was so worth it. The bed is incredibly sturdy and easy enough for me to move but for my toddler to not. It’s super easy to clean and looks absolutely adorable in her room. So worth the time, effort and money!
customer_reviews.author: Coraima Munoz

customer_reviews.title: These are so low, my kids might as well be sleeping on the floor
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these but they are EXTREMELY low to the ground. It's my first time buying toddler beds so maybe that's just the way they are I'm not sure but they definitely weren't what I was expecting. If I hadn't waited so long to put them together I probably would have returned them. I will probably be buying new beds for them in the next few months because these will not work much longer than that.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I’ve made for my sleep lol
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old loves his bed. We just transitioned from crib to this miniature bed. He didn’t like his crib, he felt caged up so he would scream for us to take him out. This bed gives him enough freedom & gives us piece of mind with the railings. It’s not to high off the ground, easy to assemble, and sturdy. It’s also cute Toy Story Theme. Well worth the money for his first starter bed.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves his big boy bed! Pros: * Super close to the ground so I don’t worry about him falling out * The characters are super cute and not wonky looking Cons: * Pretty hard to put together by yourself * Since it’s plastic it’s pretty light which means my son can push it across the floor when he wants... * There’s a bar in the center under the mattress that is extremely uncomfortable and noticeable
customer_reviews.author: Alexis H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bed!
customer_reviews.text: My son was so happy when he saw his big boy Elmo bed! Took a little over an hour to assemble but it was a pain in the (you know what). Very sturdy as well. There are times when my son won't sleep unless I'm next to him, because my room is so small, I lay on the bed with him and the bed holds up strongly (I am 5'3" 145lbs). Definitely a recommended bed for toddlers!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 2 yr old!
customer_reviews.text: Great bed, my 2 year or is so proud to be in a big kid bed. This frame bed fits a crib size mattress so it’s great that we didn’t have to go and buy that as well. I would suggest the sellers put a few extra backs to the nails because I had to do a lot of improvising towards the end. Still a great bed. My two year old can drag it, so it’s a slight weight although sturdy
customer_reviews.author: zmath

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value. Happy Toddler!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves Paw Patrol. He was so excited to see the Amazon delivery guy drop it off. Assembling the bed was a challenge and I was missing a screw but I ended up buying the part from Home Depot. The bed looks great with the matching Paw Patrol bed set I purchased to go with. He keeps raving about how much he loves this bed. He doesn't want to leave his bed. He's happy. It's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Free Spirit Vibes

customer_reviews.title: Great alternantive to a crib for abies who climb out
customer_reviews.text: Bought for one year old. Low to ground helps with those early morning roll outs while they get used to a bed. I bought two different ones for the girls and turned them opposite with the youngest to the wall. She doesn't roll out anymore and she has to wake up all the way and safely climb out. Excellent solution for baby that figures out how to pull up and out of a crib. (The youngest one is very smart.. she had three to watch and learn from)
customer_reviews.author: Christina L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great little bed, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Our just-about 2 year old daughter loves this bed so far, though she's only slept in it for 2 nights now. She sleeps quite comfortably in it, and it's low enough to the ground where she can get into it by herself and we're not worried that she'll get hurt if she rolls off in the middle of the night. We ordered the Minnie Mouse version, she loves all the stickers with Minnie and Daisy.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay C

customer_reviews.title: Simple to follow instructions made for quick and easy setup. This is a very sturdy bed that ...
customer_reviews.text: Simple to follow instructions made for quick and easy setup. This is a very sturdy bed that is solid enough to hold the weight of an adult plus a toddler for those bedtimes when extra snuggles are required. It fits a standard crib mattress and is low to the ground for easy access for a toddler. My son loves the stickers which were easy to put on. Overall this is a great product that I would recommend purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Tank

customer_reviews.title: Love this bed!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves her new big girl bed! She will be 2 in October so we decided to ditch the crib, she wanted an Elsa bed so that’s what she got. It was so easy to assemble, all together took maybe 20 minutes with both toddlers “helping”, I love the her crib mattress fits in the bed so I didn’t need to purchase a new mattress. It’s sturdy. I lay on it and it doesn’t budge. You can’t beat it for the price! My daughter is very happy so no complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: Harley

customer_reviews.title: The kid loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Son loves it! He has been co-sleeping with us. As soon as he received this Paw Patrol bed, started sleeping by himself on this bed (although he’s still sleeping in our room. I placed it next to our bed). My husband puts together the bed, so I don’t know how easy it is. It took him probably 15 to 20 mins from unboxing to putting everything together, so it doesn’t seem difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: The girls love these beds
customer_reviews.text: They were so happy and surprised to have toddler beds! I wanted some black princesses beds but it is what it is, only could find blankets, sheets and pillow cases with black princesses, there was 1 bed but had Edomites all over it *sigh* I wanted something to reflect my girls, it’s okay they have lovely pictures on the wall that shows their beauty!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Israel

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler bed
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice toddler bed, takes a standard sized toddler mattress like crib sized. Bought the bedding separately from Target because it was cheaper there. My husband put it together in about 30 minutes, no issues. The stickers are like decals that you put on yourself, but it was very easy to do. I even messed one up and was able to peel it up and redo it.
customer_reviews.author: Margo J.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This bed is awesome! I used it to transition my 20 month old from crib to bed and he loves his new bed. I got the paw patrol design and it is so cute. Needed two people to put it together but it’s sturdy enough for me to lay/sit on with my toddler. I was a little worried after reading some reviews about mattresses being too snug or too small but ours fit perfectly! We got him a matching comforter and pillow set and he has transitioned wonderfully. The bed is so cute.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Cant be jumped on by toddler.
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok toddler bed. Just cant be jumped on like my toddler did and bent the middle pole under the mattress part ( my toddler is not heavy at all, he is on the slimmer side). Now it sinks in. He barely sleeps in it. Wasted my money because he prefers to sleep on the floor with blankets. As far as stability goes it is very stable. Very cute bed.
customer_reviews.author: Sand

customer_reviews.title: it's a pain to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in what seems to be a box that had already been opened, The Item is missing two long screws according to the instruction, so I'm not at all happy with it because I can't get the side rails on! Update you have to flip those side post, the photo on Amazon and the instructions are wrong but the small photos on the box has it put together correctly, so I tried that and got it all together new
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toddler bed
customer_reviews.text: Great little bed. It took me a little over half an hour to assemble it by myself, with my toddler "helping" and my big dog lying in the way. Haha The plastic seems pretty sturdy, the whole bed actually feels pretty sturdy, surprised the weight limit is only 50lbs. Seems like it could easily handle more. The stickers don't come already on the bed so you have to apply them. That really would be the only complaint I have and it's not that big of a deal to put them on. Just need a steady hand. So all in all, it's a great bed at a great price and easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Travis & Kira Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Mine didn't fit the recommended mattress.
customer_reviews.text: Is a little too small to comfortably fit a standard toddler mattress. Makes changing sheets difficult because I have to pull the mattress off the bed and force it back. Plus the mattress is too tall and covers the design completely. Overall it's a comfy bed for my baby and he loves having his own big boy bed , but it's not a GREAT bed.
customer_reviews.author: Lexa

customer_reviews.title: My kid went bonkers over this!
customer_reviews.text: Took me about 30 Minutes to assemble this thing. Totaly overkill but kids are hard on everything so I believe it will be useful for multiple children use over time. I suggest using a drill to help speed things up. For context, I am 300# and I laid in it with my 35# son and it handled it fine. It does not come with the bedding. I purchased the recommended mattress and it fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Erick/Karen

customer_reviews.title: Buy it !
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a highly rated , good, affordable bed that wouldn’t break the bank for my two year old to transition into from his crib. This bed was the perfect match. We absolutely love it. The product has held up so well and still looks brand new after having it for almost a year ! If your looking for a good transitioning bed for your toddler then look no further. This bed is the perfect one !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, assembly was a challenge
customer_reviews.text: This bed is very cool looking. Assembly started off very easy, but when I went to attach the side rails, the holes did not line up at all and I had to make new holes. Until this point, assembly was quite simple. My son loves this bed and it looks great...but was a bit annoying to get side rails to fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: Joel McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money, I am not sure if it's just me, or if they all do this. But they seem to not be so sturdy. If or lean against it on the floor it shifts a little. Or if the kids pull it, it shifts a little. Maybe I just dont have it tight enough. But I did my best. I didnt use the stickers. I just like them better plane :) keeps the kids in there beds with out falling out. Even if they flip flop an roll around.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Fairly easy to put together.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 4.5yo daughter. She loves Minnie Mouse and just got her own room. She loves the bed. It was fairly easy to put together. I messed up and had the fabric piece upside down, even though I knew it had to be flipped. That was my own problem though, nothing with the product itself. The instructions state how the fabric should be, but my pregnancy mush brain disregarded it.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We love these character beds so much. This is the second one we have bought for our kids. The colors are vibrant and the beds are super sturdy. The only tiny thing I would have to complain about is the instructions for assembling it but other than that it is well worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Rails short but good toddler bed.
customer_reviews.text: Cute. My son loves it! Got it for his 2nd birthday! Great starter/transitioning bed. He’s sort of tall for a 2 year old & tosses and turns during his sleep. Almost fell once from moving during his sleep but good thing we checked on him before that happened. Besides the rail being short length (for us), i would recommend. Assembly was easy - took maybe less than an hr - while son was “helping” me but not really only being in the way LOL
customer_reviews.author: Nelly

customer_reviews.title: Beware Might NOT come with any instructions
customer_reviews.text: I'm so disappointed this set DIDN'T even come with instructions. I called Amazon and they were unable to get in contact with the company. They only stated to email the company for instructions. I'm disappointed I spend all this money and I get a weird looking set that didn't even come with instructions.
customer_reviews.author: NaeD

customer_reviews.title: My little Guy loves his bed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my little guy (16 mo) for Christmas, he immediately stopped wanting sleep with his mom, and sleep in his own bed. He often when feeling sleepy will get into his bed. I like that it's low enough for him to sleep in, and the built-in rails ensure that he won't roll out. Hope enjoys it for the next 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Swindell

customer_reviews.title: Cute!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to put the bed together by myself in a little less than an hour, and my daughter loves it. The only flaw is that with a standard, inexpensive crib mattress, the mattress will sink down between the three poles on the bottom. There is one at the head, foot, and middle or the bed, but the one in the middle causes the mattress to be more raised in the center. My daughter is only 3 and doesn't seem to mind, but if you have a child a little older (and taller) get a sturdier mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Cute bed
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was ok. We had to do it twice. When assembling my best advice is to put the male legs towards the headboard and the female legs towards the footboard it will make a difference when attaching the bed rails. Took the other reviews advice and added some extra support, added the mattress from the Crib which fit perfectly. So far I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: Love This Bed!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bed, came in a compact box with clear instructions. You will need a star point screwdriver for all the screws. My son loves it and helped me to assemble. We have only had it for a few days now but it feels pretty sturdy and strong. One thing I do not like is that it slides easily on the tile floor so I may have to put it on a rug to prevent the movement but otherwise it is great!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa F

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced for what you get. Assembly is a pain in the butt even with two people doing it. Holes for screws are too big. Screws are too short in some places. Cheap plastic. Cheap frame. Higher in the middle than at the head and foot so mattress doesn't sit flat. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: H K

customer_reviews.title: Cute bed and good for the cost
customer_reviews.text: My son likes sleeping in this bed. It wasn’t so easy to put together and i actually Scraped the paint off a bit trying to jam one of the pieces into place. He will probably use this for like 2 years so it’s not a great investment but for the price it’s worth it.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble - sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure who would need this for a few months. Got a twin bed instead. This Disney bed uses same mattress as crib thus it’s still so small. Kid fell out of it a few times bc it is too small for him to toss and turn. So for he like the extra room of the twin
customer_reviews.author: Marc Doubrava

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for price
customer_reviews.text: My 1.5 year old loves the bed. She's able to easily get in and out on her own because of it being so low to the ground. I've once laid down next to my daughter in the bed for about 15 mins and it held up just fine! No stability issues and it fits a crib mattress so it was nice being able to transition my daughter from a crib to a "big girl bed" without having to purchase a new mattress. The length of the bed is such that she'll most likely be able to sleep in this bed for a couple more years (she's average height for her age).
customer_reviews.author: SydneyAR

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is my Sons second bed we had one made out of composite wood and it broke within one year. So we decided to get him this one. I must say it’s very light weight but super sturdy. Cute for toddlers. Super easy to put together there is even a video on YouTube on how to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this in 2017 for my now 5 year old. Through lots of jumping and hard playing between him and my daughter, it has only just now broke and needed to be replaced. I've never been happier with a product that I didn't expect to last thing long!
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my two year old who is transitioning into her own bed and it’s a must have. She is a terrible sleeper but the side bars help her from rolling out and the size is perfect ! Very easy to assemble bed . I was surprised that it was so sturdy when she jumped up and down ! I wish she could use it forever
customer_reviews.author: Zanellmom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my little guy
customer_reviews.text: This product was perfect. We previously used a 4-1 crib that my soon to be 3 year old did not like. This Mickey bed is perfect and the crib mattress fits as well. the only draw back is that we have hardwood floor and the legs of the bed do not have a nonslip or rubber surface. Easy fix was to but sticky rubber stoppers and place them on the bottom of each leg of the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves it!
customer_reviews.text: It is a good sturdy bed especially and my 2 year old grandson loves it! The instructions were not complete (didn’t include how to put all the parts together) so this was a little difficult for me. Great deal! I purchased the mattress suggested and, with the Toy Story beddings I bought, the fit is really tight, but I still do not regret my purchases!
customer_reviews.author: CERod

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bed, holds up to a jumping toddler
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The bed was easy to assemble, and plastic seems to be sturdy. It has held up to a toddler jumping, playing, sleeping on it over the past few months. Also, my toddler loves Mickey so this bed worked out great. We just used his crib mattress in it, and it fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: bdavis2003

customer_reviews.title: Neutral blue and white bed!
customer_reviews.text: Without the stickers, the Frozen II bed is a blue and white bed that could work well for either gender (if you concern yourself with gendered colors in 2020.) Very sturdy and comfortable. I personally like a plastic toddler bed vs. a wooden one so 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Xphilesforever

customer_reviews.title: Very cute bed!
customer_reviews.text: This bed is the perfect size for a toddler. My son is almost 2 and fits perfect in it with enough space to grow. He will be able to use it for a few years I’m sure. It’s not too bulky so it fits well in our master bedroom. It’s also very cute! I recommend it. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mayra Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Sturdier than expected
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loved her new themed bed and I was surprised to find that I could lay on it with her for storytime without feeling like I was going to break it. I read other reviews that recommended putting additional slats under the mattress for support but it didn't end up feeling necessary. I think I'm going to end up buying a second one to send to Grandma's house for visits at this price.
customer_reviews.author: B.Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Nothing is labeled except the screws... the part where you lay your mattress is super flimsy.. when my son lays down he tilts inward. I’m going to buy a a slat to put under his mattress but other than this... you get why you pay for. For $58 I’m okay with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little bed
customer_reviews.text: Our twins love their beds! Honestly haven't put on the stickers yet (yup they are giant stickers) cause i like it as just a blue and red bed. The crib mattress fits snuggly so not easily removed by the littles. Great bed. Perfect buy.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Needs slats
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fine and easy to assemble. I used a YouTube video. The only issue is that there are no slats so my son's mattress is buckling around the single bar. Needs slats. Trying to figure something out. If you have a very solid crib mattress maybe it would be better
customer_reviews.author: Momof1

customer_reviews.title: Held a lot more weight than I imagined!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't too hard to assemble. I am giving it 5 stars because I bought it for my 4 year old grandson. He and a few other toddlers have jumped up and down on it with no apparent stress to the bed. Then, much to my amazement one of my friends who I would say weighs about 135 lbs and is about 5' 3" laid down on it with her 2 year old toddler, until her 2 year old drifted off for a nap. The bed held th their weight just fine to my amazement. So I am giving it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: R Bower

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the product and product support
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. The safety rails are not proper and they were not snapping to the leg. The safety rails width is more than what it should be. I had contacted the retailer, it's a long long wait time, and what they said is that cannot replace the parts. Beware of the product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute and sturdy but takes a while to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: We got this as an economical solution for our Paw Patrol loving grandson when he sleeps over. It is very cute and he totally loves it! It’s durable but very difficult to assemble. It took his uncle and I, 45 minutes to assemble a few pieces of plastic because some of the fastening areas are awkward to reach. You will also need to purchase a crib mattress to fit is as the smallest blow up type mattress is still too large.
customer_reviews.author: Kcuret

customer_reviews.title: A 2/3 year olds dream bed
customer_reviews.text: My daycare child loves her new bed. We didnt put the stickers on yet and using it as a Moana bed. The colors go perfect with all the bedding for Moana. Wonder if Delta could make stickers for Moana and Frozen to put in the box and let us choose like they do for some of their other toddler beds that I bought. Anyways, it got one of them out of the crib finally and she is just in love..
customer_reviews.author: Teena Rockwell

customer_reviews.title: My Daughter Loves This Bed
customer_reviews.text: This is my daughter's first toddler bed. When my husband and I were putting this bed together, it took less than a hour to put together. It was definitely easier than most furniture we had to put together. My daughter walked in and saw her bed, and just fell in love with it. She climbed on it, laid on it, jumped on it, and slept in it. No complaints, the bed is pretty sturdy. I would definitely recommend to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Morillo

customer_reviews.title: Nice, sturdy, affordable bed
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy toddler bed that was very affordable. Only problem we had was the assembly. Not all the pieces fit as well. We had to improvise a bit to get them all to fit properly. Otherwise, very satisfied with the quality and price.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: ... together it will support the child very well and comfortably do not put a whole lot of weight on ...
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to put together be sure to purchase a mattress with it which will cost about as much as the bed once put together it will support the child very well and comfortably do not put a whole lot of weight on it like try to lay in bed with them as I doubt it support that of course the stickers that are provided with it make everything worthwhile giving the Spider-Man appeal if my son loves it I love it so we love it
customer_reviews.author: sParKiEO McShizzle

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Toddler loves it. Easy to piece together. Our old toddler bed I (130lbs) was able to lay down with my toddler. This one I’m afraid to since it says 100lbs max. So I lay my head on the pillow and hope that’s good enough for my toddler
customer_reviews.author: Cierra_67

customer_reviews.title: Just what we wanted!
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter absolutely loves this bed! It is much sturdier than I had anticipated which was a pleasant surprise. Not too difficult to put together either. We already had the crib mattress and wanted this as a transition bed for a year or two. It is perfect for this purpose. Low to the ground so she can get in and out of bed herself. Glad we made this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Great bed but the stickers peel off fast
customer_reviews.text: Our son loved this bed! It’s build well and it’s easier to assemble. I rated four stars because the stickers started to peel off within the first month. I’d hope the stickers were better quality for the price of the bed but unfortunately they are not. Overall we would recommend this bed just beware the stickers may peel off.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey wommack

customer_reviews.title: Cute durable beds
customer_reviews.text: Wenought two beds. We love the easy to assemble & easy to clean bed. They are light enough to be moved without strain. They have been jumped on, moved, dirty & they still look new. I believe they are indestructible. I keep telling the kids (age 3 & 5) not to jump or stand on them worried they will break but the havent yet. As much abuse as these beds get Im surprised they are not trashed. Go kids.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Jo Richards

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, cute and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Super simple set up, I have slept as a 200lb mama in the bed with her for a few hours to help her to sleep a few times now and it even held my weight lol. It's a great bed and my daughter adores it. It helped me transition her to her own room (finally!!)
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The stickers that go on the bed came all folded and wrinkled and messed up. And the screws don't go all the way in to where they are supposed to before getting tight causing the bed to not go together properly. My 2 year old was very excited to sleep in her new bed today. And sadly I will have to return it and buy a new bed.
customer_reviews.author: Jess&Chris

customer_reviews.title: Mattress didn’t fit with the side pieces on
customer_reviews.text: So the bed was for the most part pretty easy to put together. I put it together while my husband was at work but if I had waited for an extra pair of hands it would’ve been easier. The only reason I’m giving four stars instead of five is because I had to remove the side pieces because the mattress was too big. I used the same mattress from my daughters crib from infancy to toddler. Once I removed the side pieces the mattress fit perfectly. Overall my daughter loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Harmony Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Little First Time Bed for Toddler
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our 16 month old granddaughter who was ready for her first big girl bed. Could not beat the $65 price tag. Son said it was easy to put together and was sturdy. Her crib mattress fit perfectly and should fit her until she is 4. It is mostly plastic except for the hardware so I can't give it a 5. Please with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Katanajo

customer_reviews.title: Toddler approved parents buy this
customer_reviews.text: So we bought one from the warehouse that had adamged box for $10 cheaper than a brand new one it was in perfect condition easy to assemble and looks wonderful my little one loves his big boys bed and its honestly very light weight so you can move it and just a reminder this does not have a mattress so please make sure to buy a toddler mattress or make sure you have one
customer_reviews.author: Daniel O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I debated on whether to get this or not because of some of the bad reviews but I am so happy I did. I guess I got lucky and all of the parts were there. It was a lot easier to assemble and then some of the reviews said. This almost 60 year-old put it together all by herself. Got it for my three-year-old granddaughter. Got the betting that goes with it and it is so cute :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves his bed
customer_reviews.text: It was time for our grandson to move up to a toddler bed at the time he was really into Paw Patrol so we got this for him for Christmas that year. that was a year and a half ago he is still using it and loves his bed. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: candlelite1

customer_reviews.title: Broken bed
customer_reviews.text: The bed did not come with the mattress I noticed a small dent in the bed but payed no mind until a week later the bed is completely broke I do not have the funds at this time to replace it I was hoping the next bed I buy from Amazon will I get some type of credit however my grand son loves it and won’t let us throw it out until we have a new one any suggestions
customer_reviews.author: beyond beauty

customer_reviews.title: Kid loves it, mom hated putting it together
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was a nightmare to put together... I assemble things all the time and this was one of the worst. Once together the frame is sturdy but the railing don’t sit on right. The fact that it seems warped is probably one of the reasons it was so impossible to put together. Little boy LOVES it and is finally sleeping in his own bed. It was really cheap and will be a great transition bed.....
customer_reviews.author: Karen Eisenbiegler

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all!
customer_reviews.text: Everything was excellent for the toddler bed the only problem is that my son grows too fast so the bed is getting a bit cramped for him, he is 4 years old. Other than that it is a great bed and for the price and the quality is great!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Cars Bed is Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The bed is great my son loves it, this is a very sturdy bed and our crib mattress fits perfect. It took about 20min to fully assemble, the stickers are not put on for you and can be tricky to put on. I would def recommend using the sticker install tool they supply, it makes things easier and helps keep the air bubbles out.
customer_reviews.author: Dean E Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Great paw patrol toddler bed!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves paw patrol and at 3 years old I wanted to finally transition him into his own room instead of cosleeping with me. As soon as I saw this bed I had to get it for him. It was fairly easy to assemble and seems really sturdy for a toddler bed. The stickers were easy to assemble as well. Most importantly, my son loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Trussell

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I got it as a second bed to have in my room when my toddler is scared to sleep alone, but it was very easy to assemble and is so much sturdier than expected and could be her regular bed. My toddler loves the Peppa designs on it too :)
customer_reviews.author: Emily Soriano

product_meta.title: Delta Children Plastic Toddler Bed, Nick Jr. PAW Patrol
product_meta.description: Style:Bed| Color:Paw PatrolThere's no job too big and no pup too small for Chase and this Nick Jr. PAW Patrol Plastic Toddler Bed by Delta Children. Featuring adorable decals of Chase, Marshall, Rubble and all their furry friends, this sturdy toddler bed provides a safe sleep space that your little one will WANT to stay in all night long. Designed with attached guardrails and a low height that makes it easy to climb in and out of, the PAW Patrol Plastic Toddler Bed by Delta Children meets JPMA, CPSC and ASTM safety standards, so you can feel secure with your growing child using it night after night. No bleach
feature_bullets: Features two attached guardrails Uses a standard crib mattress (sold separately)
Sturdy steel frame and high quality plastic construction Assembled dimensions: 53.94 L x 29.13 W x 26.18 H Inches
JPMA certified to meet or exceed all safety standards set by the CPSC & ASTM
Recommended for ages 15 months plus. Holds up to 50 pounds

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars7,587 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
